reviewText:
VCI Entertainment and Conquest Productions presents "PENNY PRINCESS" (1952) (94 min/Color) -- Starring Yolande Donlan, Dirk Bogarde, A.E. Matthews, Reginald Beckwith, Mary Clare, Edwin Styles, Kynaston Reeves, Desmond Walter-Ellis & Peter Butterworth

Directed by Val Guest

Another winner from the British Invasion released by VCI.

A delightful blend of British romantic comedy with Yolande Donlon who inherits a teeny tiny little county of Lampidorra.  The citizens there have a thriving industry that has kept them going for years - the industry of smuggling.

Enters Dirk Bogarde who is on a trip to Switzerland to learn about the cheese industry. It seems as though the Lampidorrans have a kind of cheese that they playfully refer to as Schmeeze.

How does Schmeeze work, well that's the gimmick to the whole film. There are a few bumps in the road, Schmeeze solves all the problems both financial, geopolitical, but can it solve the romance department between Donlan and Bogarde.

Dirk Bogarde was well cast in the part which was at the beginning of his career as a romantic heart throb.  Much earlier than his acting ability that finally kicked in later.

Special footnote: -- Donlan later married Val Guest, the writer and director of our little gem, and stayed married for 50 years!  Guest was better known for writing and directing his sci-fi flicks, in both the UK & the US.

Beautiful in color -- Yolande Donlan made this even more so, as she played one of the most adorable female leads I have ever seen. You can't help but love her--and her sweet and kooky character did a lot to carry this film. As for the plot, it's quite good -- Highly recommend.

BIOS:
1. Val Guest  (Director)
Date of Birth:  11 December 1911 - London, England, UK
Date of Death:  10 May 2006 - Palm Springs, California

2. Yolande Donlan
Date of Birth:  2 June 1920 - Jersey City, New Jersey
Date of Death:  Still Living

3. Dirk Bogarde  [aka: Derek Jules Gaspard Ulric Niven van den Bogaerde]
Date of Birth:  28 March 1921 - Hampstead, London, England, UK
Date of Death:  8 May 1999 - Chelsea, London, England, UK

Mr. Jim's Ratings:
Quality of Picture & Sound: 4 Stars
Performance: 4 Stars
Story & Screenplay: 4 Stars
Overall: 4 Stars [Original Music, Cinematography & Film Editing]

Total Time: 94 min on DVD/VHS ~ VCI Entertainment ~ (July 19, 2011)

Pleasing movie for when you just want something light, funny and clean. Enjoyed it very much.
I did not like this movie at all .. Quit watching it halfway through . Fell asleep twice actually watching it .. Figured it wasn't worth finishing .
Boring
A fun and very British movie, which rather universally pokes light-hearted fun at all cultures involved.
It was just too quirky for me.
hilarious! Absolutely a family movie!
It's a nice little story, however improbable, but a nice change from all the violence we are exposed to in so many movies.
Cute little movie.  A little corny, but, thats what makes it cute.
Cute movie, but I found some parts to be a bit silly and slow.
Silly but in a sweet way
A charming British film made in 1952. It has the drama and acting skill of that era. It guarantees a good nights sleep. In saying that, I do not mean to deprecate the film. It is just the way it is.
Great family movie!
Great flick!
A sort of sappy, happy story in a make believe country, with actors and actresses that I don't think made it to the big time.  It was silly yet sort of fun to watch.
Silly, fun, light film.
I typically appreciate old movies, but not this one

It was a film that was probably made in the 1950's. It was a cute story especially if you like watching older films. There were a lot of funny places in it that made you chuckle. The ending was too abrupt for my liking though.
A little corny..
Decided early on it wasn't for me.
Funny, charming and silly, but I loved it.
Fun
This was kind of 'silly', but cute and clean. :)
Did not finish watching it, kind of slow
It was really fun to watch once.
Weak acting and poor script
Everything you want in an old film.
Funny, but midway through loses some of it's life.
Ok movie, falls flat at the end
It was okay definitely something different.
This was a fun movie.  Not the best I've seen, but entertaining if you like old movies!

Light-hearted and well paced with a female lead that didn't play the stereotypes or typecasts of the period (other than being a gorgeous blonde)--the Penny Princess was smart, visionary, loveable, full of enthusiasm, and quick to recover from any challenge. It's a fun movie! It moves and rides on fun. Boring if you are looking for drama and drama tension; if it is your cup of tea, it is relaxing and refreshing as a straight-forward script and a charming actress lift your spirits by doing the little things--thinking of others, foiling plots, and finally, a couple of silly twists at the film's climax.
Funny, romantic, and FUN!
We're convinced this movie inspired Monty Python and the Flying Circus. Could not stop laughing. Good clean, albeit silly fun!
A light and fun movie for the whole family!
a very enjoyable pleasant old time movie
It was bad.
Cute and light movie

It was a pretty stupid movie.  I had NEVER heard of it and was curious what it was about.  My adult daughters and I all watched it and all
agreed it was not worth the time watching, but luckily we all were doing crafting so the time was not totally wasted!
Started out ok
Nice movie
Good.
Delightful!  A feel-good movie to lift your spirits after a stressful day!
interesting and unique comedy
Clean old fashioned movie.
Decent old movie.
Too outdated though I love old movies.
Cute predictable plot line but fun to watch.
ok
This was a soapy movie, but for its time probably exceptional.  could be updated and made as a Hallmark Channel flick.  I enjoyed it as I was looking for a soapy type movie at the time.
Didn't cre for the movie at all.
entertaining movie, hilarious.
Fun little movie with clever, lighthearted story.  Good for kids.

I think the ending was a bit hurried and a little lame.  If it wasn't for that, I would have given it a higher rating.  Obviously this is not a "greatest movie ever", but it was cute and was worth the time spent watching it.
Silly and nonsensical yet entertaining.
Ridiculous old timey story but the cloths are amazing.  I love to see the period clothing and set designs.
Cute low key typical British comedy.  Since I enjoy old British movies, I enjoyed it, but I think it would appeal to that many younger viewers.
Cute little movie.
This was sweet and funny. I really enjoyed the acting. But I'm only giving it 3 stars because they rushed through the end.

It was a perfect piece of English comedy frozen in time. I read the other films of the lead actress and I can't believe I never noticed her before. And a young Dirk Bogarde is adorable. It is a silly little fluff of a film, very much like THE MOUSE THAT ROARED. If you want to plop down, not think of anything and relax, with a cup of tea and a piece of cheese (spoiler alert!), then watch PENNY PRINCESS.
Okay
Fun and light hearted, a simple sweet comedy.
This was just the right movie for a night when I wanted a light comedy
This old movie was funny, enjoyable and entertaining. I love old movies and this one has just been added to my list of oldies. Great movie, they just don't make them like this anymore.
It is funny; a tad corny.  Could be used to teach a 100 level marketing  course.  On the other hand great entertainment when you are tired and bored.

I watched this when I couldn't sleep and it was a relatively pleasant way to dawdle away an hour or so.  However,
I found it quite pompous of the two Americans to come in and play princess and consort to another country.  I
realize after WWII that Americans were proud of themselves for helping Europeans save the world, but the idea
that every country after that war was subserviant to the US, had few good ideas of their own, were stuck in their old ways, and couldn't help themselves leaves a bad taste in my mouth.  I guess the best attitude is to laugh at it.

There were some humourous snippets, usually not the ones leaned on by the director. The reprise of the banquet number on the road to smuggling scheeze was hilarious.  And I simply hooted at the hair.
Cute movie !
Not really very good.
Great plot,lovely story and very enjoyable, lovely sceanery
This movie was just delightful. Comedy spread throughout, even my 11 year old loved it!

This was a cute movie made in a time when movies were made for entertainment, not to see how raunchy they could get with language, violence and sex.  I loved the clothes of the era, but always wondered how young women who worked retail could afford to buy the clothes they wore.
Just to corny
Very heart warming and funny.
Very enjoyable.
Cute
Sappy, happy movie. Loved it.

Built like a classic operetta:  They meet cute, they fight, they get married - all in a faraway country, in this case "Lampadorra". This movie is  frothy fun.  It stars a charming so-young-as-to-be-practically-larval Dirk Bogarde and Yolande Donlon as a somewhat relentlessly "quirky american girl" and a menagerie of character actors as the villagers of this fantasy country whose chief industry is smuggling and "Schneese", a local cheese with that gets you high and happy with just a few bites.  (Hmmmm.)  A light Schneese souffl of a movie, sometimes that's all you want.
Cute movie!
Cute, silly old movie to watch on a rainy day...
Not quite average.  Dialog, story line & characters just ok.  If you have some time to kill & not a lot else to watch, it will do.  Otherwise, take a chance on something else..
Too boring to watch it all the way through.
A quirky fun old movie!
Delightful. Funny. A real gem.
Very entertaining. I would give it 3-1/2 stars.

Wonderfully entertaining classic old movie. Great for light entertainment. But, I gave it three stars, because it's as if the script writers were going along and said, OMG, we're out of time and budget. I know, let's just have them walk off into the sunset. And they do--literally. No addressing the main issues of what has been driving the plot, (we'll just dash that off in a sentence or two). I just kept hearing myself saying out loud, "Really, REALLY? That's IT?!!!"  And it was so lovely up until the last 5 minutes...when everyone packed up and went home off the lot.
A sweet predictable movie
Just a cute movie with a happy ending.
A little far fetched but interesting.
Way Too goofy for me, didn't even finish it.
Cute and light.  Not up to the usual find standing of Dirk Bograde.
Good movie but it ended abruptly. Would have liked to seen more
Cute clean movie.  Loved the. Story.  Acting was good,  plot.  Loved the whole thing.
old movie cute plot good family intertainment...
It is just cute. A funny little old movie that makes you smile for just a little while.
Refreshingly wholesome entertainment, also teaches a good work ethic and other values missing in society today!
Fun, but not well done.

Unsophisticated, but fun and quirky. She is made a princess by chance and shows some pluck in solving her problems. The Schneese element was very funny. The message of thanks to the people of the small country she inherits shown at the beginning of the film is really funny. It was an innocent and fun watch, and that is a refreshing change.
Amusing, but humor is somewhat slapstick.

Silly but not horrible. grab a puzzle or your knitting and prepare to waste the time. You won't feel as if it's time you'll never get back but you won't want to brag about how you spent your time either.
Cute, more a two and one half movie than three.
Poorly written, too slap stick as well as poor photography.
Old but quite amusing
Really fun movie.  Previously overlooked.
dumb movie...
I couldn't watch more than half.
It was a pretty decent movie. I liked it but my husband did not.
4 stars just for the cute factor.  My 25 year old daughter didn't understand it but still thought it was a hoot.
The main actress was just annoying.
Get your schneese on
cute
Fun movie and very enjoyable!  A cute story with lots of lite humor and twists of simpler times :)
The Penny Princess is a fun and cute romcom straight out of the 1950s, with old-fashioned romance and comedy. Great movie for families and those who enjoy older movies.
Fun movie.  I would recommend it to anyone who would like to just kick back and relax for an hour or so.
Boring and badly acted

Penny Princess,  is a little bit how she got the country her great uncle who pass way and that inherit it.
And what down there to see what going on there!!
Cute movie.
Lot's of parts don't really make a lot of sense but they don't need to. This isn't a serious movie, just a silly story for fun.
Simple, cute movie.

The worst thing about being a classic film lover is that eventually you will run out of old films. But when I joined Amazon Prime I found a treasure chest of old classics I've never seen before. So far Penny Princess has been my favorite and the true jewel in my treasure chest so far. This movie is full of quirky characters including the lead and a must see for any classic movie fan. This is truly a fun vintage British comedy!
Silly and full of giggles.
Cute movie, little dorky at times
This is a cute and fun oldie!
Cute! I am sure there were some references that this movie parodied, but I am un familiar with the 50's.
Charming film. Excellent service. I am very, very pleased indeed!
There are many likeable characters, though an unbelievable story.  A funny pro-capitalistic film that almost achieves a romance in there  too.

This movie ran on cable when the kids were very young and we all loved it. It was the first time we saw and appreciated a Val Guest film. The female lead, Yolanda Dolan, is an American who sets her character off perfectly against the British farce plot line and Dirk Bogarde's flawless performance. If you enjoy post WWII British comedies, don't hestiate to see this one.

I watched this film in the early 90's in german TV and it really impressed me. But I forgot the name and no one knew the name when I told about this little smuggling nation and its creative product of a cheese with Schnaps.
Google did not help me at all to find it with the bits I remembered.
Now its a real treasure to me and I love all the detailed humour in it. It was even better than I remembred.
The only thing I missed were other language versions.

PENNY PRINCESS (1952) is a delightful British comedy, seemingly cut from the same cloth as THE MOUSE THAT ROARED.

Yolande Donlan plays a ditzy, blonde New York shop girl who inherits a massive fortune from a very distant relative that she didn't even know existed.  Among the assets of the estate is an extremely small European country that is flat broke and whose principal industry is smuggling.  Ms. Donlan travels to that small state and is immediately declared to he its ruler, but now she has to devise a plan to put the country on a firm financial footing.

Dirk Bogarde co-stars a cheese salesman for a large British corporation, who encounters Yolande and, after a few romantic misunderstandings, helps her achieve her goal.

There is so much to enjoy in this movie.  It has a clever, satiric story, witty dialogue and the cast is quite likable.  Indeed, Ms. Donlan, a Judy Holliday type who played BORN YESTERDAY on the London stage, is absolutely charming and one can't help but wonder why she did not have a major film career.

Perhaps it is because she had a long marriage to the film's writer-director, Val Guest, and chose family over career?

My only complaint with PENNY PRINCESS is that it ends very abruptly.  Suddenly, a character rushes in with a telegram...and "everything" is resolved.  It almost feels like the production company ran out of money and they were forced to wrap everything up immediately.

That reminds me of a story that I heard Huntz Hall tell years ago.  Huntz was, of course, one of the Bowery Boys, and their movies were shot in 7 (?) days.  One of these low budget quickies was going into overtime on the 7th day when the producer, Ben Schwalb,  called "That's a wrap!"

"Ben," Huntz objected, "we've still got ten pages of script to shoot."

"Nobody'll ever miss them," Schwalb said.

He was probably right, but PENNY PRINCESS is not a Bowery Boys movie, and I'd really like to have seen how Guest had originally planned to end this often laugh-out-loud comedy.

VCI Entertainment is releasing this nicely restored film onto DVD.

 Michael B. Druxman
Cute movie.
Very silly vintage comedy - but I was in just the right mood for it, and quite enjoyed the romp!
